result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L Shaurette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven L Shaurette is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven L Shaurette was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven L Shaurette
Current: 209 S. Carol St., Johnson Creek, WI 53038 United States  (Effective: 07-21-2017)

[MA]Case called at 10:35am
Defendant Steven L Shaurette in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent, Nina Hanfler present in courtroom gallery

ADA Shock requests that probation be extended to allow for restitution to be paid. 
The Court extends Mr. Shaurette's probation for 1 year. 

recess: 10:38am
Probation review hearing on July 20, 2017 at 10:30 am.; rescheduled due to a calendar conflict
Probation review hearing on July 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
DOC Balance Inquiry

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from DOC requesting clarification of the probationary term ordered for Count #2

Cases 15CF409, 16CM77, and 16CM139 called together at 10:03am 
Defendant Steven L Shaurette in court, in custody with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance; submits Victim Impact Statement/Restitution Request for 15CF409.

Counsel verify receipt of Pre-Sentence Investigation report and have no factual corrections to make.
--the Court notes the author of the PSI, Nina Hanfler is present in the courtroom gallery

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
recess: 10:16am---reconvene: 10:20am

Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Wineke

As to Cases 16CM77 and 10CM139, Atty. Wineke confirms that there is a nexus between the Defendant's behavior and the amounts requested.
As to Case 15CF409, as restitution hearing will need to be scheduled

Family members/friends in gallery introduce themselves

Statement made by Mr. Shaurette
recess: 10:30--reconvene:10:59am  [to allow the Court time to review victim impact statements]

The Court confirms review of the PSI and Victim Impact Statements
The Court questions Agent Hanfler
The Court questions Mr. Shaurette

On Cases 16CM77 and 16CM139, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years.
The Court orders the conditions as layed out on page 15 of the PSI.
[which are: 
--full time gainful employment, school, or conbination thereof
--no contact with Matthew Hansen
--participate and successfully complete any classes, counseling, treatment, or therapy your agent deems appropriate
--payment of all court obligations and supervision fees]

The Court orders restitution for cases 16CM77 and 16CM139 to be a condition of Probation, resititution is to be payed to individuals and in amounts as layed out in the criminal case settlement.
--ADA Hall clarifies that Chris Scholl should only be listed one time in the amount of $710; and that restitution should be joint and several; the Court orders as such.

On Case 15CF409,the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 5 years.
The Court orders the conditions as layed out on page 15 of the PSI.

The Court orders as a condition of Probation on case 15CF409 that Mr. Shaurette is to serve 10 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH

The Court orders Mr. Shaurette to provide a DNA sample upon demand.

The Court further orders as a condition of probation on each case, that Mr. Shaurette is to pay all statutory costs.
Upon inquiry of Atty. Wineke, the Court clarifies that the terms of Probation all begin forthwith and are concurrent in nature.

Days credit for time already served:  62  days on Case 15CF409

The Court schedules a restitution hearing for case 15CF409; the Court invites parties to submit a stipulation on restitution prior to the hearing for the Court's approval, shall they come an agreement.

recess:11:45am

NEXT: As to Case 15CF409: Restitution Hearing on 10/28/16 at 1:00pm ((allow one hour))
Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Criminal Case Settlement
with Elements

Cases 16CM77 & 16CM139 called together at 8:37 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Steven L Shaurette in court, in-custody, with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified, no requests to be heard. ADA Hall submits Victim impact statement for case 16CM139 & confirms that restitution information was previously received in case 16CM77. 
Court so finds victim rights compliance

16CM139: Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #
1 and bars it from further prosecution
Counsel agree that all of Mr. Shaurette's cases should be heard together for sentencing
Recess: 8:56 am

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 8/4/16 at 10:00 am (with 15CF409) - Send notices
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven L Shaurette
Current: 449 E Racine St Apt 5, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 05-16-2016)
Prior: 209 S Carol St, Johnson Creek, WI 53038

Cases 16CM77, 16CM139, 15C409 called together at 10:22am 
Defendant Steven L Shaurette in court with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF409;;
Parties are prepared for trial

Atty. Wineke submits Motion in Limine, Witness List and Proposed Jury Instructions

The Court inquires of Atty. Wineke her non compliance with Court's scheduling order.

As to Defendant's Motion in Limine:
The Court declines to find that the request as to Paragraph 4 of the Motion in Limine is timely; Atty. Wineke withdraws paragraph 4
The Court take no action of paragraph 6

Defendant's Witness List:
The Court strikes paragraph one


As to Case 16CM77, scheduled for Plea/Sentencing:
On Defense's request to adjourn plea and sentencing; DA Happ defers to the Court
The Court questions Atty. Wineke of the reasoning for request for adjournment.
The Court believes that this case should proceed to plea today

Mr. Shaurette indicates that he wishes to proceed to plea on Case 16CM77.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Counts, #4, #6 and #8 of Case 16CM77; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads in and dismisses: all other counts applying to Mr. Shaurette in Case 16CM77

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess:11:03am

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing(16CM139) & Sentencing (16CM77) on 6/16/16 at 8:30am
Status conference on May 16, 2016 at 10:15 am.
Scheduling notice

Cases 16CM139, 15CF409, 16CM77 called together at 2:54pm [mo]
Defendant Steven L Shaurette in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to 16CM139(Initial Appearance occurs):
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at Klement Towing
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

The Court appoints Atty. Wineke to represent Mr. Shaurette on case 16CM139; the Court directs that the pay plan remains the same

As to the Pretrial Motion in 15CF409 and 16CM77:
-16CM77: lack of objection to the State's Motions
--State's Notice to Admit Statement; granted
--State's Notice of Witnesses Prior Covictions; Mr. Jung will not be impeached with any convictions

-15CF409: 
--State's Notice to Admit Statement; granted
--State's Notice as to Expert Testimoney; State will provide Atty. Wineke with CV of Expert no later than 5/2/16
--State's Notice of Evidence of Flight; arguments given
--State's Motion Admission of Other Acts;arguments given

recess: 3:51pm

NEXT: Cases 15CF409 and 16CM77 to remain as scheduled// Case 16CM139: Status Conference on 5/16/16 at 10:15am
